page.title: 16HOUSING, RUGELEY
page.content: The population of Rugeley in 1985 is about 30,000. The old town centre is less than half a mile across and now houses few people. Most live in estates built along the valley and on the higher ground towards Cannock Chase. Houses are not built on the valley floor because of waterlogging (the Trent was dredged to reduce flooding). Most of the old terraced houses in the town centre have been demolished to provide car parks and service areas behind the shops. Two large estates (Pear Tree and Spring- fields) were built in the 1950's when the colliery and power stations were opened. The large Etchinghill housing estate was built in the 1960's and 1970's with the small Chadsfields estate. In the 1980's new houses were built at Albany Drive and in the town. Council houses were also refurbished.
